author: {'steamid': '76561198154425859', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1468972705}
review:
[h1]TurnOn lights up the platforming action with a delightfully fun mixture of puzzles & side-scrolling gameplay.[/h1] Taking visual maze-work to a new level, Brainy Studio has created a unique platforming action comic book that will keep you entertained as you struggle to solve these perplexing levels. 

A high sense of player agency is accomplished through this game, in the way that the gamer is able to see solutions having an effect on the world created in the comic book narrative. Each problem solved gives a sense of satisfaction that translates into the visual story you are playing out. 

[b]Comic Book Narrative:[/b]
The graphics are incredibly well done, in a heavy battle for supremacy with the audio soundtrack. You begin each level with a set of comic strips that basically gives you an indication of what you are expected to â€˜fixâ€™ in that level. So, the game is heavy on story while using no language. I know, right. I wouldnâ€™t have thought it could be done. But, there it is. This story is not dropped at any point, but plays out very dramatically in the conclusion. 

The art is old-school Americana, with poignant scenes described by level titles like, Beware of Dog, School Routine, Unusual Date, Mad Tram, The Smell of Trouble, Mass Rally, and Pursuit in the Sky. The helicopter battle level & the chopper high-wire level were two of my favorites. But, the Ferris Wheel was definitely spectacular as well. The level early on with the Drones was definitely a difficult levelâ€¦ probably the most difficult, since I was unsure of the requirements at first. So, the level difficulty doesnâ€™t really increase or decrease, since each level is built on a different and unique concept. This provides a lot of variety, as well as visual appeal.

The art is, as I mentioned, a comic book style, but the level maps are built in a medium that looks like modeling clay, and is very pleasing to the eye. Lots of primary colors are used throughout, so the overall effect is definitely enjoyable and artistic. It makes it difficult to believe so much can be accomplished with a four man team. This high level art translates into some very nice profile backgrounds if you collect the cards. 

[b]Audio, Audio, Audio![/b] 
With a wide variety of music from old ragtime syncopated rhythms, to peaceful piano melodies; TurnOn is ear-candy. The only thing missing is some serious dlc for the soundtrack. I know I enjoy listening to game soundtracks, like some of the really great ones from Paradox games, while Iâ€™m doing other things. If TurnOn gets a soundtrack, I will definitely be adding that to my playlist on my Smartphone. 

The game fx is creative & diverse. The voice sounds of the npcâ€™s can be annoying with repetition. But, I enjoyed the sound effects that came with the actions, as most of them were audible cues to success. 

I received a copy of the game free for review purposes, but that in no way affects my review since I only play games I would enjoy. I do think it would be worth the price, even if you donâ€™t catch it on sale since the hours in-game are definitely worth the price. And, I will gladly buy any dlc that is later offered. 

[b]Gameplay[/b]
TurnOn is one of [i]those[/i] games that forces you out of the box of language by using just picture cue cards and visual, color, & light cues to guide you through the levels. Even when speech is used with the npcâ€™s, itâ€™s just mumble-jumble, intended only to convey the urgency of a cry for help from people who are suffering some mishap because the power is out. That does serve to direct you, since the levels are not laid out linearly. The gameplay itself is linear, as you must complete one level to proceed to the next. But, within a level, the end action may be anywhere. Also, many actions donâ€™t open up until youâ€™ve performed other actions. So, you will find yourself zipping back & forth, & around & about a level to complete all the tasks. 

The game can be broken into halves at about the point of the Ferris Wheel. In the 1st half, you are still learning new â€˜tricksâ€™ to battle your way through the game. But, in the 2nd half you find the intensity picks up into some really awesome speed platforming. In the very beginning levels I missed some things, simply because I didnâ€™t understand the visual cue system. So, Iâ€™d say this is not a game you will only play through once. 

A number of the achievies are miss-able. I earned 80% on my first play-through, (which took me 12 hours) & will definitely be replaying some levels to find the others. Part of the reason for this is the fact that parts of each level are hidden, & activating the end-level action is not always obvious until youâ€™ve done it. Then, you missed some things. Of course, you can choose to replay the level immediately if you want, but I think most of us want to get to the end first, regardless of what we missed. 

What I originally perceived as bugs turned out to be mistaken assumptions in the scoring system. Without saying more to prevent spoiling it for you, itâ€™s definitely a unique system that encourages trial & error, as well as total mastery. The map is divided into areas, with levels within each area. It looks like there are 28 levels in all. Each area has about 3 levels that are the norm puzzle-type levels where you explore & trigger generators, looking for the end action. Then, each area ends with a high-wire speed level, where you basically play in side-scroller fashion by jumping across gaps in the power lines, trying to stay on the wires until you reach the end.  

You are scored in each level at the end by how many lamps light up on the scoreboard. There is no indication of what scores are needed to get â€˜3 lamps.â€™ This needs to be added, along with level numbers on each scoreboard for those like me who want to look back at screenshots & compare results. 

[b]UPDATE: Actually, I realized after posting my review that you can see you many points are needed to score 3 lamps by looking at your achievements page. You can see, for example, that you have achievied 134 of 136 on a specific level, meaning you were short by 2. So, basically, the requirements vary by level.[/b]

[b]Controller or Keyboard?[/b] 
The controls are simple WASD & usually only 2 keys at a time are used. I preferred using the keyboard controls for accuracy & versatility for most puzzle levels. However, I found that using my Steam controller on the high-wire levels provided more speed. So, it looks like the type of game that if you really get into it like I did, then you will find yourself swapping back & forth on the controls.

The game is similar to Tales from Space: Mutant Blobs Attack. If you enjoyed that, where you donâ€™t see the whole level at once, but search high & low for bonus items, then this game is for you. However, TurnOn is not as difficult, & much more engaging to me, probably because of the art style & music, as well as the simpler gameplay.

[b]Proâ€™s:[/b]
* Unique levels designed & crafted individually
* Variety in game play
* Awesome music for each level!
* Eye-pleasing art with an engaging story

[b]Cons:[/b]
* No indication of how many points needed to score three lamps in a level 
* Individuality of levels tends to leave difficulty a bit unbalanced from start to finish 

[h1]You are sure to love the music & art in this entertaining extravaganza of creativity. I highly recommend TurnOn for hours of platforming puzzle fun for everyone![/h1]

This is one of the brightest and wonderful platformer, which I ever played! The game is very colorful, elegant and have very nice music, and that is important - the game pretty darn exciting. 
The game tells us about the power of lumps, which is attempting to restore electricity in the world. You'll travel through the wires, step by step, level by level, solving puzzles and giving light to the world.

The game levels contain two type of games, one is a â€œrunnerâ€, where a little creature moving alone, your goal donâ€™t fall down and collect a little electric. Second game type is a â€œplatformerâ€, there your main goal is moving at lines and bring an electric in all thing what need it. At some places game need some thinking from you, but mostly here need only your skills. If you fall down, you will start a current level from last checkpoint, but all what you collected till this time stay at you. Also at some levels you will find something like â€œbossâ€ fights.

The game graphic world completed nice, every is well animated, colorful. 
The game soundtracks is beautiful and relaxing.
 
So my verdict
 
+nice graphic
+challenging
+nice story telling
+great music
+steam achievements and trading cards
+many supported languages
 
-the â€œrunnerâ€ levels sometimes a bit frustrating
 
If you like this kind of games or screech something relaxing, this game is for you. This game have a great music, nice graphics and storytelling. This game is for all ages but a childâ€™s especially should like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171904534', 'num_games_owned': 2533, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1468466002}
review:
ğŸŒŸ Review

By far the most beautiful and enjoyable platform game I ever played in years.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
TurnOn is a platform game on 3D full of puzzles and secrets, you are an alien power that literally runs by electrical wires. Has simple controls, making it a enjoyable game, you can jump from wire to wire and your main objective is to go through parts of the city by solving small puzzles and bring back the light. But I recommend you get light all that is in stage, this will give you a better score at the end. During the stages you will go through a mini-game a bit more challenging where you should go jumping from wire to wire avoiding falling to the ground. Game loadings are fast and has a awesome optimization.

[h1] Graphic [/h1]
Amazing, even it's not the latest generation, TurnOn has a unique graphic style, abusing of the lighting effects, is a pleasurable gameplay for hours. Detail that really impressed me was the cutscenes in comics style that appear in stages, have vibrant colors and a mild stroke.

[h1]Soundtrack [/h1]
Original, orchestrated and impressive. It molds to stage events.

[h1]Grade: 10/10[/h1]
TurnOn is a game to elapse the time and relax. Has easy puzzles and a perfect playability.
Abusing the sound effects mixed lights and the incredible soundtrack, the game immerses you for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970312414', 'num_games_owned': 5131, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1468391284}
review:
TurnOn ist ein Platformer mit einem sehr netten Artstyle und wirklich schÃ¶ner Soundkulisse. Man steuert so etwas wie eine Energiekugel und muss das Licht in Electro City wiederherstellen. Bewegen kann man sich auf Stomleitungen, zwischen welchen man hin und her hÃ¼pft und dabei Generatoren einschaltet, Strom in Form von Blitzsymbolen einsammelt, kleine RÃ¤tsel lÃ¶st und so den Bewohnern hilft oder auch ab und zu Gegner besiegt.

[h1]Grafik:[/h1]
Grafisch ist das Spiel durchaus stimmig, durch die 3D-Perspektive (eigentlich 2,5D) ergeben sich sehr interessante Persektiven-Spielereien - man kann sich zwischen den "Ebenen" bewegen (ist schwierig zu erklÃ¤ren, dazu bitte einfach das Video am Ende anschauen). Die Story wird durch comicartige Zwischensequenzen erzÃ¤hlt (mit animierten Standbildern).

[h1]Sound:[/h1]
Die Musik passt wunderbar ins Spiel, ich habe glaub ich noch kein MusikstÃ¼ck ein zweites Mal gehÃ¶rt - die Palette reicht von sanften KlavierklÃ¤ngen bis hin zu treibenden Beats - je nach Level. Auch am Ingame-Sound gibts nichts zu meckern.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
Ein Standard-Plattformer mit interessanten Ideen in der Perspektive und ein paar RÃ¤tsel-Einlagen zwischendurch. Es gibt auch immer wieder mal kurze Abschnitte, die eine Mischung aus Runner und Rockband sind. Man "lÃ¤uft" automatisch auf den Stromlinien entlang, sammelt im Takt Blitze und versucht, Gefahren auszuweichen.
Sterben kann man in dem Spiel auch, indem man entweder runterfÃ¤llt oder 3 Mal von etwas getroffen wird. Die Checkpoints sind allerdings so fair verteilt, dass dies grundsÃ¤tzlich kein Problem darstellt - auÃŸerdem behÃ¤lt man alles bisher gesammelte.

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Ein wirklich schÃ¶nes, rundes Plattformer-Spiel. Klar gibt es kleinere Bugs, aber der Gesamteindruck ist auf jeden Fall sehr positiv.

[h1]Hier noch ein Gameplay-Video:[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GKRue9OsaEU

author: {'steamid': '76561198008146889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1470639768}
review: TurnOn is a really sweet, fun side scrolling platformer that is beautifully done and has eaqually beautiful music to go with it. Really enjoyed playing it and I'd recommend giving it a go if you fancy something a bit more chilled out than your usual games.

review:
EspaÃ±ol:
Muy buen juego de plataformas, casual, en el que vas viajando a travÃ©s de los cables de electricidad de la ciudad. Es una idea bastante original, y el juego engancha. La dificultad va aumentando poco a poco, y solo me queda decir que lo recomiendo, desde luego.

InglÃ©s:
Very good platform, casual game, where you travel trough the electric wires of the town. It's a very original idea, and the game captures us. The difficulty, in addition, increases gradually, and I only have to say that I recommend it, of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969489294', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1469010293}
review:
TurnOn is the perfect game for the casual gamer. The levels are short, but they don't feel too short.

The visuals are beautifully hand drawn. The sound is great, and the music soundtrack really makes the game shine.
 
In all, it's very well put together and I'm sure you will have a great time playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109077728', 'num_games_owned': 2448, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1468336213}
review: I won this game during a giveaway, and I've gotta say. It's better than I expected, I love the overall look and feel of it, the music is so relaxing and calming and the graphics is beautiful. I also love how the game Dev is in the opening scene and you have to help him. I would honestly recommend this to anyone. It's also a fun game to earn some extra achievements and unlock some cool trading cards. GET IT, NOW :) xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198120303388', 'num_games_owned': 1709, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1467666536}
review: The unique design and style, stunning graphics, atmospheric music, a variety of levels make you forget about reality and relax. Exciting gameplay and original story! To receive a portion of inspiration! Great job! Thank you, Brainy Studio for a kind and good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083616168', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1489432449}
review:
This game looks beautiful and has some enjoyable gameplay. I really like it. It's a good game to play when you just want to relax and chill out.
EDIT August of 2017: I only said this because I got it for free. I'm gonna stop recommending this game because I didn't enjoy it. It's just another completionist game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055935750', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1473224338}
review:
There is an issue with using an XBO controller on Windows 10 (contant movement to the left), which is noted as a known issue in the troubleshooting discussion.  It is allegedly a problem with the Unity engine.  However, since I have many other titles which use the Unity engine, which all work fine with the XBO controller, this issue should be able to be fixed.

I can't recommend this game until this problem is resolved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281959242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1467086165}
review:
I've been keeping tabs on this game since I came upon it and upon seeing the art style, I KNEW I wanted to give it a look. 
I wasn't disappointed. Yes, it only took me around three hours to complete, and I plan to go back in and gather the rest of the achievements, but I believe the music and the atmosphere it creates in-game are what really sold me. As we all know, long games do not always equal good games.
The lack of speech does nothing to attract from the overall  "narrative" (though the few times a woman yelled was, it was cringeworthy~ :P ) and having sunk hours upon hours into the game, Journey, I have no issue with that.
I almost wished to know more behind the scientist and our little energy-laden protagonist, but the story sort of lends itself to your imagination in that aspect.

I used an XBox controller to play, so I never tried this out using the keyboard only, so I can't really speak to that particular aspect of the controls. Playing is pretty intuitive and the controls are easy to pick up. So, I'd reccommend this to really anyone~.

Turn On is a very relaxing play, and only once did I find myself stuck, just briefly as I learned the level layout.

I am very happy with my purchase. I must also note that I paid for this game during the Fourth of July sale for $8.99. It's a little steep for the length of the game, but with a regular price of $15.00, I felt it was justified given those whom make games deserve something after producing something that requires so much hard work. (Not something I could do!)

I look forward to seeing what more comes from this developer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198048980407', 'num_games_owned': 2513, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1468945925}
review:
[h1]Portable Description[/h1]
TurnOn is an extremely adorable platformer without platforms. Following a blackout event, an â€œalien creatureâ€ traverses through electrical lines in an effort to bring light to those who need it most. Child-friendly gameplay, cute aesthetics and visual storytelling elements make this game a truly relaxing ride through Electro City. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[u][b]The Spark[/b][/u]
Professor Brain needs help following an accident at the power station in Electro City, so he employs a cuddly alien creature (spark). The player controls this spark in an effort to bring electricity back into homes, activate failed generators, and maintain order throughout the shambling city.

There are lots of easy achievements that promote exploration of the many levels in TurnOn, including: an achievement for turning on 3 lamps for each level, an achievement for lighting up X in each level, etc. Animated comics, along with NPC actions throughout gameplay, provide immersive visual storytelling along with insight on upcoming levels.

[u][b]Platforming Elements[/b][/u]
In this platformer without platforms, the player traverses through electrical lines in order to progress. Many familiar platforming elements are utilized, such as: jumping/falling, hazardous objects, hidden pathways/alternate routes, collectibles (lightning), checkpoints, and a lethal fall (the ground). Even though TurnOn is a 2D platformer, its artistic use of multiple platforming depths/layers and multi-linear progression makes it feel almost like a 2.5D platformer. 

Most of the deaths in TurnOn stem from missing a line/jump and falling to the ground. Every now and then, hazardous objects or an enemy (drone) will attribute to it, but this is a very friendly/casual game so thatâ€™s generally not the case. You can die from falling as many times as you need, without any penalty, and restart from a checkpoint. Any previously acquired lightning will remain in your possession. Specific objects, however, will hurt the sparkâ€™s health (denoted by 3 green lightning bolts); these are red lightning bolts (collectibles) or enemies. If the spark loses all of its health, the level will restart, and all collectibles will be returned. Green lightning bolts can be collected to recover lost health.

One of TurnOnâ€™s most challenging, yet most exhilarating, elements is with its use of runner levels. On these levels, the screen and spark will progress forwards at an uncontrolled pace. Often times these runner levels are themed and present many active animations. A major aspect that makes me love these levels is with its great harmonization with the music. You will find yourself jumping and falling to the melody and beat changes (adds a lot of joy and promotes immersion).

Even though I personally enjoy the runner levels, the other platforming levels also provide a great deal of fun with its visual cues. Each level is themed, and often times, the spark will have a specific goal: guide the little girl back home by lighting up the street, scare away burglars by repowering alarms, revive a householdâ€™s energy consumption, etc. This variation in level design and immersion through effortless storytelling helps keep the player compelled to continue playing.

[u][b]Video Gameplay[/b][/u]
https://youtu.be/U0Kik73QmM8
[h1]Controls[/h1]
[u][b]Controller Support[/b][/u]
The controls for TurnOn is very simplistic; 1D movement, jump, and fall. Although the controls, by default, are sufficient for gameplay when using a controller or M&K, there is no support for rebinding controller/keyboard buttons. This shouldnâ€™t be too big of an issue as precision handling is not required, but many platformer veterans may want to be aware of this.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u][b]Current State of the Game[/b][/u]
The developers of the game seem to be very active with regards to player support and update frequency, as seen in the Discussions board and News updates. After only 5 days of release, a major patch was implemented to take Letâ€™s Plays and Review feedback into consideration. Details of the patch can be seen [url=http://steamcommunity.com/games/TurnOn/announcements/detail/798641005146904200]here[/url].

[u][b]Advised Suggestions[/b][/u]
Even though TurnOn is fairly polished, there are a couple suggestions that may improve gameplay; these are listed below.

[list]
[*]Make the areas that the spark can travel through (on runner levels) more noticeable.
[list]
[*]Some portions of the wire (even if unlit) can be traversed â€“ very confusing at times.
[/list]
[*]Allow controller/keyboard rebinding.
[*]Fix minor visual bugs.
[list]
[*]Awkward contact collision against walls.
[*]Abrupt screen jumping when traveling through terminals at times (almost as if travel animation is spliced in between starting/ending positions).
[/list]
[/list]

[u][b]Verdict[/b][/u]
TurnOn is a very relaxing and addictively fun product. Its cute aesthetics, visual storytelling and harmonic runner levels earn it a recommendation for any fan of platformers or child-friendly/casual games.

[table][tr][td]Review copy provided by Brainy Studio LLC[/td][/tr][/table]

[table][tr][td][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/BeforeYouBuy]Before You Buy[/url] â€“ analyses of newly released indie games[/td][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561197997119811', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1466796264}
review: This game has some "obviously not made for PC" issues, like the "Press A to Continue" on menus, and an extremely mobile-friendly feel, but if you're someone who likes hyper casual relaxing games then this will be perfect. Otherwise, like me, you'll get pretty bored since you can play the entire game with one hand and there isn't much in the way of difficulty to speak of, but the environments and artstyle are well done and it's fun to look at. It's also generous with the achievements if you're into that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014453566', 'num_games_owned': 1236, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1465740201}
review:
I was quickly taken in by TurnOn. It bills itself as a platformer without platforms, and while thatâ€™s not strictly true, there's a focus on exploration and puzzle solving that the genre isnâ€™t especially noted for. Itâ€™s a game about restoring power to a darkened city, which you do by moving a grinning alien spark around power lines until itâ€™s able to reactivate circuit boards and power grids. 

Thereâ€™s a kind of understated plot behind it all, dealing with aliens made of electricity, but itâ€™s all kind of nonsensical. And thatâ€™s okay, because it makes it no less adorable. Exploring a world draped in darkness and reactivating the lights is strangely satisfying. Most levels are very laid back affairs, asking you to explore until you meet certain criteria, such as saving a girl walking home alone from an angry dog, or uniting two lovers at their favourite restaurant by clearing their way. What was once something as simple as turning on lights slowly dials up in complexity. You might have to activate cranes to drop metal platforms across pits, or reactivate traffic lights to clear massive congestion.

Full Review // http://www.honestgamers.com/13025/pc/turnon/review.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198141401549', 'num_games_owned': 2944, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1465928205}
review:
[quote]Need a breather on heavy, mind-pressuring games? This visually captivating, auditorily pleasing, side-scrolling platformer is what you're looking for![/quote] 

[h1][u][b]Game Overview[/b][/u][/h1]

[b]TurnOn[/b] is a casual, side-scrolling platformer that conveys a story through stellar audio and visual presentation without the use of words. (Except for the guides and instructions, of course)

In this game, you control an alien that takes the form of an electric ball and lead it through its journey to restore the light in Electro City.

The gameplay is pretty simple and straightforward - you traverse through electric lines/wires and apparatuses which activates and/or repairs them through contact while collecting blue lightning symbols. Each of these actions will have an impact to the score you will get upon finishing the level. Still seeing people in need through the level? Search again for hidden paths that you might've missed.

Also, you will find adversaries that might stand either your way or the people living in the city, and some of them require different mechanics in order to be cleared. Though there isn't a game over that could force you to start over, there are still some cases that may halt your progress through the game. 

Falling through the lines and touching the ground will result in you being sent back to your checkpoint, but everything that you have collected are still with you, every apparatus activated, and no damage taken. However, if you exhaust your life bars (represented by the green lightning symbols on the upper left part of the screen) you will restart the level from the start.


[h1][u][b]The Pros[/b][/u][/h1]

[list]

    [*][b]Charming, Calming, and Hilarious Gameplay Experience[/b] - Summarizing the gameplay experience that I felt as I played through the game, it was very calming, charming, and fun experience that I would proudly say that I enjoyed it thoroughly. I mean, I never would've thought that I would see a character in a game crying over not having a cable signal. If that doesn't seem funny enough to you, then I guess you're Jaden.

    [*][b]Artistic Game Graphics[/b] - The game is very appealing through and through in each of every visual aspect it presents. The landscape and scenery fits the very theme it presents on every level, as well as the visual effects filled in it. The character models are clean and well-animated, along with the comic-strip cut-scenes. And most of all, the aesthetic lightning work in each and every level is impeccable.

    [*][b]Beautiful Game Soundtracks[/b] - Ranging from serene piano tracks to cheerful up-beat songs, this game has a lot to offer in the auditory department. And when I do say a lot, I really mean it. Each and every level has its own unique track and aside from the cut-scenes and the map soundtrack, almost nothing was ever re-used. Everything is quality-made and the proof of that are the hours I spent listening to the tracks while idling the game. If there is something that is missing, it is the availability of a soundtrack DLC for users to listen and enjoy.

[/list] 

[h1][u][b]The Cons[/b][/u][/h1]

[list]

    [*][b]Irritating Sound Effects[/b] - Although the game has a pretty good array of soundtracks that is very pleasant to the ears, there are certain sound effects that will make you tone down the level due to discomfort, especially if you're new to the game. A good example of this is when you "respawn" to your checkpoint upon touching the ground. Fortunately, the game lets you adjust the volume of the sound effects. However, the downside is that you might not know other SFX that you're missing to hear.

    [*][b]Hard to Navigate[/b] - Just to be precise, I am pertaining to the game having no cut-scene skip and absence of the settings menu while you are on a level. Regarding the cut-scenes, you can actually speed them up by continuous left clicks or by spamming the ESC button, however, it still takes at least five (5) seconds in doing that before you proceed to the level. Having an option to skip them would be pretty handy for people uninterested or has already seen them several times. Same goes for the settings, which should be available while in-level instead going back to the main menu just to adjust the volume or video settings.

    [*][b]Minor Visual Bugs[/b] - During the course of my play through (which I could safely assume that I've reached at least one-thirds of the game), I have encountered two minor visual bugs, though take note that these bugs didn't have any impact on my play through. The first one I found was on the end part of the "School Routine" level which involves a speaker still being highlighted in blue even after activating it, and the second one is when you're going through the level selection and passing between the "Bulb Monument Street" and "Unusual Date" levels which shows an empty flat terrain. 

[i]Both of these bugs are recorded on my screenshots page here:[/i] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/rankmenotplz/screenshots/?appid=428220] (Screenshots)[/url]
[/list] 


[h1][u][b]The Verdict[/b][/u][/h1]

Truthfully, there isn't much of a discussion to this considering that I can't find anything that big of negative aspect could persuade you into NOT buying it (unless you're not into casual gaming). And if you are a fan of this kind of game, I'm pretty sure you will love it.


[quote]If you like to see more recommended games that is worth the value you are paying, please visit my other [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/rankmenotplz/recommended/]reviews[/url], or follow our curator group at [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/GoodGamesGR#curation]Good Games Giveaways & Reviews[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198092152890', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1465243966}
review:
Don't let the short play time fool you, I've actualy finished the game in offline mode. 

TurnOn is one of these games that don't focus specificly on gameplay alone, but rather on the atmosphere. You are a spark which can only move between wires, which makes the game a platformer. However, because the enviroments are in 3D, you will also be moving back and front, which can cause some confusion. Another thing that bothered me a bit was the camera, which, I feel, was a bit to close in certain parts. However these are only minor gripes in an otherwise very well made game. 

Your job will be helping all kinds of people and with the aid of the soothing music, it is a great combination to enjoy yourself after a long day at work/school. The game is also apropriate for younger children, however they might not be very good at it because of the previously mentioned 3D enviroments. However, that is not a big problem because it's actualy very hard to "lose" (it is possible by hitting to many red sparks or enemies). If you fall to the ground, you will simply resurrect at the checkpoint without loosing anything. 

While the gameplay is fairly basic, the atmosphere is the part to enjoy. When you start a level, it's mostly dark and depressing. After running around for a bit, it slowly gets brighter and brighter and the people get more and more happy. The sequences in the form of a comic book are a nice adition too and you will be seeing them quite a lot. 

To wrap things up, while the price isn't that low, I feel the game is worth it. It's not one of those competitive games to raise your adrenaline but rather a soothing and calming adventure, which often brings up a smile to your face. If only the camera was a bit further away at some points.

Final rating: 7.5

author: {'steamid': '76561198028673669', 'num_games_owned': 7010, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1465489363}
review:
This game is the great platformer for kids, not very easy, not very hard, colorful with nice OST and pretty time-consuming:

+Visuals: it looks great, various levels have each has different effects.
+Great OST: I like all the music tracks and they fit the entourage like a glove.
+Gameplay: personally all the levels I've completed were pretty easy + the game is not very punishing if you die a lot, you do not always have to start from the beginning of the level, because there are checkpoints, and overall difficulty pretty low. If you ignore collecting 100% of the lightnings and lighting 100% of the objects it would be even easier, otherwise, it could add challenge on some levels.
+Time consuming - this game is BIG for such a project - I've wasted like 4 hours and completed like 25% of the game so far.
+Steam achievements
+Steam cards
NPC characters reminds those guys from sims :)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=700458417

After all its a best buy for your kid, or if you like lighthearted platformers :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198131625443', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1676788441}
review: I loved my time being a bright little dot hiding out and platforming along these glowy nighttime electrical grids. The atmosphere is colorful and Tim Burtonish and delightfully gloomy. Lots of secret areas with legitimately odd achievements.  I mean, there's a furniture party. And the soundtrack! It's all this old jazz that I never knew existed. I got it for free from a dev group, but I really like it anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089408872', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1465491527}
review:
Where the hell can I grab the OST?

This game kills it with its collection of one of the most soothing OSTs I've ever heard.

Still has flaws here and there tho. But so far it proves itself to not be another text-book, ordinary platform game on the market. Grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302443422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1465254123}
review: Judging from the acheivements I earned I'm about half way done with the game. I was going to wait until I completed the whole game, but I can't. I got stuck on a runner level and was getting sick of it (seriously, I was about to just quite the game for good for how much I loath this pointless level) until I finally did beat it (and was overjoyed for about two seconds)... until my alien zoomed straight past the score board for that level and and the game proceeded to basically bug out and get stuck. The animaltion of rain and the music was still going, so it wasn't frozen, it just failed to animate the scoreboard after I went past it. I hate that level so much, beating it once should have been enough (it didn't count me beatingthe level becaue I had to quit out of the stuck scene). So I think I'm done with this game. I want my money back, honestly. Nearly 3 hours wasted on this.

review: TurnOn is the ideal game for relaxing after school or work. It has great peaceful music and nice visual. If you are a completionist, this game will satisfy you. There are tons of "lightning" to collect and many lights and houses to light up. I feel really satisfied at the end of a completely lit level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067937537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1464977951}
review:
TurnOn is what I would call a casual platformer. The game is not very challenging but is a fun game if you want something to sit back and enjoy and not have to worry about tough jumps or time limits. The mechanics are pretty simple as you jump between different power lines in the city to turn the city's electricity back on. The game includes some puzzles which mostly involve exploring to find what you need to turn on in order to proceed. Despite not being much of a challenge, I had a lot of fun with TurnOn.

Another area where TurnOn excels is its' atmosphere. TurnOn is a really charming game. The graphics are pretty nice especially as the levels light up as you turn on the city's lights. The music fits the mood perfectly. The thing that stood out most to me though was the little storylines in each level. An example is a level where you guide a lost kid back to their house. The main story could have been developed a little more but the game does such a great job creating a charming environment. 

While I really enjoyed TurnOn I have two issues with the game. As already mentioned the game is really easy. You will breeze through most of the levels. If you are looking for a challenging game, TurnOn is not it. The difficulty leads to the other issue which is the length. Since you can breeze through the levels the game ends up not being very long. I finished the game in around 4.5 hours. Unless you want to go for all of the achievements it will probably take you around the same amount of time to beat the game. 

If you are looking for a really challenging game, you might not like TurnOn but otherwise I would recommend picking it up.

Check out my full review at [url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/turnon-indie-game-review/] GeekyHobbies.com[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993537005', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1464976916}
review:
[b][u]See written review below[/u][/b] or watch it here: https://youtu.be/x8iT-xV39Yg
[h1]THIS IS A MIXED REVIEW! TL;DR: SKIP TO CONCLUSION![/h1]

TurnOn is a cute platforming adventure with some levels using aspects of a running game. In TurnOn, you play as an alien creature (that looks like a ball of electricity) in a city shrouded in darkness, and itâ€™s your goal to help the citizens, and restore the power and lights.

You travel along the powerlines and telephone poles jumping from one to another to bring power back to the city. There are two styles of levels: one is more of a casual platformer, and the other has some of the aspects you would see in a runner game (like Temple Run, or Bit.Trip Runner).

In the platforming levels, you move to power up things as you go, and in some levels you are basically escorting the characters through the levels by opening doors, and setting off alarms to scare away the bad guys. Contrary to the casual platforming levels there were other levels that resembled a simpler version of running game. You are forced down the lines with no way to slow down or speed up, and all you can do is jump from one wire to another.

Fortunately, there were more platforming levels than runner levels, but I spent a lot of time dying repeatedly on these runner levels. I donâ€™t like runner games, and I admit itâ€™s partially because I just plain suck at them, [strike]but I really hated these levels. I found it frustrating to play them, and I felt a sense of dread every time I encountered these levels. It really took away from my overall enjoyment of the game. With how casual the rest of the game feels, and then to have some levels like this eat up so much play time, these levels felt out of place.[/strike]

[h1][i][u]UPDATE:[/u] There have been several patches to address the runner levels being too difficult. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/428220/discussions/0/350532536105528124/](more information)[/url][/i][/h1]

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list][*]story is short and sweet
[*]cute and colourful animation and art style (image boards, and short cinematics)
[*]the platforming incorporates using objects in both the foreground and background (it took a bit of getting used to, but I didnâ€™t experience too many issues with the platforming)
[*]good, enjoyable, casual platforming levels[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list][*]music was good for the most part, but it was fairly repetitive (especially in the areas where you die repeatedly)
[*]some very annoying sound effects (i.e. sirens) - but at least you can adjust the volume [i][u] UPDATE:[/u] Some of these sound effects have had their volume lowered.[/i]
[*]an occasional bug where you could sometimes be able to move around in the air until bumping into something
[*][strike]the runner levels feel like there's a lot of pressure on timing; if you donâ€™t jump directly to the wire, you get air time, and are unable to control yourself while in the air, and sometimes not be able to make the next jump[/strike] [i][u] UPDATE:[/u] Several adjustments have been made to improve these levels.[/i]
[*][strike]on the runner levels, the controls sometimes felt sluggish after landing, and you couldnâ€™t always jump from the wire, even though you try to[/strike] [i][u]UPDATE:[/u] The responsiveness of jumps was increased in some runner levels when players try to jump form the very end of wire.[/i][/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
The game took me 4-5 hours, with at least an hour and a half of that dying repeatedly [i]before the changes were implemented[/i]. While it wasnâ€™t the most frustrating game Iâ€™ve played, I would have probably skipped on playing this game if I had known about the runner levels. At the same time though, I did enjoy the other parts, so Iâ€™ve got pretty mixed feelings about the game as a whole. [i][u]I have changed my review from mixed negative to mixed positive to better take into account the many updates the developers have done.[/u][/i]

If you like my reviews, please feel free to join my Steam group, and follow my curations [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AzralynnReviews#curation]here.[/url]
You can also view this review on my website [url=http://www.azralynn.com/turnon-quick-game-review/]here.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030711210', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1464620783}
review:
Developed by Brainy Studios, Turn On is pretty cool platformer, where you control an unnamed Alien made of electricity, on his quest to bring energy to a de-energized city. A pretty cartoony artstyle, some simple controls, and a creative way of traversal Turn On itâ€™s an Indie game with great ideas, and Brainy Studios ,who  at the time of this review, is a team of 4 people, really put the effort into it, and manage to keep me engaged in this cool little platformer. The overall theme could be better explored, and thereâ€™s not real challenge for â€œHardcore Gamers!â€, but itâ€™s a game you should give a chance and try it out. Brainy Studio, you got me Turned On! (haha) for any future projects, and Iâ€™m expecting to see more from you guys.

Score from F to A

Gameplay A
Story C
Presentation B

Final Score it's a  B


Watch the full review on this video.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WKLeezriCAY

review:
played this game today  has a nice addictivness to it ..had to use the keyboard that sucked but i really liked the art design in the game the sounds were great  scientist sounde strange when he cheered lol  music as you play is hit and miss but its a minor grumble i usually turn of the music anyway when i play platformers 
id recommend it although it can be easy to play which suits me fine im whizzing past the level 
hope to have a reveiw on my channel later today  as the game does not run smoothly on my pc hardware issue not a game issue  

pros
excellent design and art
sounds great
cute hero even if its a ball of electric
slow pace suits me but there are some tricky puzzles all fun
imaginative play and fun mini quests using your powers to power up streets  houses and people gadgets
variation nothing is boring nothong repeats itself always plenty of thats cool moments
bad guys are shocking lol

cons
camera view distracted a couple of times but didnt detract from gameplay enjoyment
in game music hit and miss but im fussy  suited the game though.
not on ps4...YET

author: {'steamid': '76561198002584777', 'num_games_owned': 5313, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1465175679}
review:
A simple, but stunning game with an amazing soundtrack, that deserves to sell by the bucketload.  There is nothing quite like it on Steam.

Each beautifully crafted level tells a different story that unfolds in a series of sequences triggered by your little ball of electricity solving puzzles along various wires!

10/10 for originality!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086402386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1464808568}
review:
The gaming market is dominated by fast paced, action packed games, which are fun, but sometimes it's nice to slow things down. Which is where TurnOn comes in. A casual platformer developed by the four man team of Brainy Studio, TurnOn features some great relaxing music, colorful art style, and creative level designs. 

TurnOn is a narrative story told through comic-like cutscenes and during the gameâ€™s levels. After a power station accident, an alien becomes sentient by fusing with the power stationsâ€™ systems. Players take control of the little ball of alien electricity as it makes it way throughout the city trying to restore the citiesâ€™ power. Players travel along the electrical wires throughout the power station, residential, and commercial districts of the city. Players must solve puzzles like helping a little girl get home safely and fighting crime by setting off alarm systems to scare off looters. 
The levels of TurnOn are wonderfully colorful and dynamic. The power lines allow players to travel seamlessly from the background to the foreground. This gives each level the feeling of being three dimensional despite the games 2D art. What slightly contrasted this great feature was that the electric alien of the game would not change in size when moving from the foreground to background in some parts of the game. It was minor, but it still made the character seem out of place compared to everything else, which would shrink and grow in size as the gameâ€™s camera moved back and forth. The gameâ€™s puzzles in each level were not overly challenging. It mainly just took a bit of exploring and common sense to realize which power box to jump into to activate more lights or to stop traffic lights for someone to safely cross the street. The slower paced and relaxing puzzle levels of TurnOn were juxtaposed by racing sequences. During these, players would jump between four different wires at a time, trying to collect as many hovering lightning tokens for points, while avoiding falling to their deaths or hitting the red tokens, which when three were hit, you died. 

TurnOnâ€™s art and music were two awesome parts of the game. The lighting in the game feels bright and vibrant due to its contrast with the blackout of the city. The background is painted with a darker color palette of blues and purples, that still give the game a fun and cheerful feeling, without making it feel dark and gloomy. People also populate many of the gameâ€™s scenes, usually in distress about one situation or another, all related to the citiesâ€™ blackout. This helps the city feel alive, and being able to watch them cheer or enjoy their lives again with your help adds to the satisfaction of completing each puzzle. The music of TurnOn was one of my, dare I say it, turn ons. The casual gameplay and vibrant colors are complimented by the smooth jazz throughout the game. The music during the puzzle scenes adds to the relaxing mood and made this game one of my favorites to come home and play after work. The racing sequences of the game had faster pace music to compliment their gameplay. The developers definitely hit the mark with creating a great atmosphere for their game with the music.   

TurnOn is a very enjoyable and relaxing platformer that is great for adults and kids. The colorful art style and smooth jazz music fit well together, while the simple gameplay and dynamic level design made it fun. I did run into two bugs during my playing, but both of the them were easily fixed by simply reloading the level from the previous checkpoints and neither occurred more than once. The developers were quick to respond to my email about the bugs, so I am sure that these minor kinks will be fixed soon. 

Pros: 

Colorful art style

Relaxing music

Dynamic levels

Fun gameplay

Controller support

Steam Achievements

Comic-like narrative

Kid friendly

Simple controls

Support for 18 languages (check Steam for list)

Cons:


Few bugs (minor and easy to get around)

Character does not change size with movement from background to foreground sometimes


 
The developers provided a copy for the game to be reviewed, this did not affect the writerâ€™s opinion of the game. 
          
You can also check out my team's website : http://www.thegamerholics.com/ . We have plenty of gamign news, content, and a youtube and Twitch team with even more for you to watch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023592838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1464790931}
review:
While TurnOn is short, it is still a load of fun. It is host to amazing music, a wonderful art style and a challenging yet fun style of platforming. As you travel around the different locations of the city, turning everything back on again, it is always satisfying to see the effect of your actions. Such as scaring away looters and people who are taking advantage of the darkness to perform bad deeds. The musical sections in which you must travel along a long bridge of power lines in beat with the music are also a nice break in between areas. The game also subtly spreads the message of environmental awarness in a nice and calm sort of way, without sounding all preachy about it. If you are a fan of colourful, cute and musically satisfying games, then TurnOn is the game for you.

See my full review of the game here at Blot gaming.
http://www.blotgaming.com/game-reviews/turnon/

Also see a Let's Play of the game from another member of Blot gaming here.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZG_-exfpMEQ
